title: Himachal vs Delhi cops: Major showdown over arrest of Youth Congress members — how drama unfolded
content: A pre-dawn arrest operation in Rohru by Delhi Police for a protest-related FIR escalated into an inter-state clash. Himachal Pradesh Police intervened, citing procedural irregularities and a complaint of forcible detention and CCTV DVR seizure. After a legal battle, a transit remand was granted, but further detentions occurred, highlighting a jurisdictional dispute.

title: 'Living in la-la land': India slams Pakistan's 'incessant propaganda' at UN
content: India strongly rebuked Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council, dismissing its allegations regarding Jammu and Kashmir as "incessant propaganda." New Delhi highlighted the region's development budget exceeding Pakistan's IMF bailout and pointed to infrastructure projects like the Chenab Rail Bridge as proof of progress, asserting that Kashmir is an integral part of India.

title: After SC rap, NCERT 'trying' to retrieve sold copies of now-withdrawn class 8 textbook
content: NCERT is recalling 38 copies of a Class 8 textbook after the Supreme Court strongly criticized its content on the judiciary. The Chief Justice of India took suo motu cognizance, calling the portrayal a "deep-rooted conspiracy to defame" the institution.

title: IND vs ZIM: India hope batters improve against off-spinners in must-win game
content: India's opening pair, Abhishek Sharma and Ishan Kishan, have struggled significantly in the T20 World Cup, averaging a dismal 6.8. Abhishek's poor form, marked by consecutive ducks, is a major concern, while the middle order also faces challenges against off-spin. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak remains confident in their ability to bounce back.

title: Elon Musk sends a ‘karma’ message to Microsoft founder Bill Gates
content: Tech titans Elon Musk and Bill Gates are once again at odds, with Musk's recent "Karma is real" comment fueling their ongoing feud. The rift stems from Gates' reported $500 million bet against Tesla's stock, a move Musk publicly condemned.  Musk has also predicted Gates' bankruptcy if Tesla's value continues to soar.

title: Trump to raise tariff to 15% or more for some; no hike for China
content: Greer said the Trump administration does not plan to raise tariffs on Chinese imports beyond their current levels, as President Donald Trump is expected to visit China in the coming weeks.

title: Tech start-up CEO says he’s being forced to leave Sweden amid product success
content: Indian entrepreneur Abhijith Nag Balasubramanya is stepping down as CEO of Hydro Space Sweden AB and leaving the country due to the Swedish Migration Agency's denial of his residency. He cited 'xenophobia and hostile' immigration policies, alleging gross incompetence and systemic hostility from the agency, which he claims forced him to sell his successful agri-tech startup.

title: Telangana senior sweepers earn Rs 2L a month, says chief secretary K Ramakrishna Rao
content: Telangana's monthly salary and pension bill has quadrupled to Rs 6,000 crore in a decade, with power utility chief engineers earning up to Rs 7 lakh and senior Class 4 employees around Rs 2 lakh. This surge, driven by successive pay revisions, has intensified competition for government jobs, despite the state's strong economic performance and revenue growth.

title: Bill Gates admits affairs but denies involvement in Epstein crimes
content: Bill Gates has admitted making a "huge mistake" in associating with Jeffrey Epstein, telling staff at his charity foundation that he had affairs with two Russian women but denying involvement in the disgraced financier's crimes. "It was a huge mistake to spend time with Epstein" and to also bring Gates Foundation executives into meetings with Epstein, he said.

title: Canada signals shift, says India not linked to violent crimes anymore
content: Canada now believes India is not linked to violent crimes on its soil, signaling a diplomatic thaw ahead of Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit. This shift follows months of strained ties and high-level security dialogue, with Ottawa confident alleged activities are no longer continuing. The visit aims to stabilize relations and expand cooperation in various sectors.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang backs Pentagon's right to use AI in Anthropic row
content: The US Defense Department has given AI firm Anthropic a deadline to ease usage restrictions on its models, threatening a $200 million contract loss. Anthropic, citing concerns over autonomous weapons and surveillance, has resisted. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged both sides have valid points, suggesting the dispute, while significant, isn't catastrophic for either party.

title: 'Yadav Ji ki...' doesn't defame community: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea to ban or alter the title of the film 'Yadav Ji ki Love Story'. Justices Nagarathna and Bhuyan found no negative portrayal of the Yadav community in the title, deeming the petitioner's concerns 'wholly unfounded'.

title: T20 World Cup: After the Ahmedabad blip, India have no room to slip up
content: India are up against an opposition - Zimbabwe - that already silenced a home crowd in the group stages when they beat Sri Lanka in Colombo, and Thursday presents them another opportunity to replicate that success at the noisy Chepauk. Both teams find themselves in a must-win situation and Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl didn't venture into the "dangerous" territory of silencing India in India.

title: Gangster ‘Naveen Boxer’ claims responsibility for firing at Lawrence Bishnoi lawyer’s car
content: Delhi Police have registered a case after shots were fired at a car carrying a lawyer allegedly linked to gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. A social media post, purportedly from rival gangster Naveen Boxer, claimed responsibility, accusing the lawyer of acting as an informer and middleman. The attack, which saw four rounds fired, is under investigation with CCTV footage being analyzed.

title: 'Had arms, Molotov cocktails': Cuban forces engage gunmen on speedboat allegedly from US
content: Cuba reported its troops killed four individuals and wounded six others after a Florida-registered speedboat entered its waters and opened fire. The government claims the boat initiated the exchange, injuring a Cuban officer. Suspects detained stated their intent was terrorism, raising tensions between the US and Cuba.

title: Ex-YouTuber texts mother in Kuwait, hangs self at Hyderabad home
content: A 20-year-old student tragically died by suicide in Hyderabad, reportedly due to unrequited love. The undergraduate, who previously created content for a YouTube channel, was found hanging in her rented flat. Her mother revealed a prior suicide attempt and a three-year relationship with a software employee who allegedly rejected her advances.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly emotional ahead of wedding to Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have a lot of plans to make about their future together as they are all set to turn a new and the most exciting chapter of their lives. Amid this, it seems the billionaire pop star is struggling as she faces emotional turmoil over her involvement in Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's legal drama, that has lasted over a year now.

title: AI protest fallout: 20 Delhi cops detained in Himachal, freed & stopped again
content: A jurisdictional dispute erupted after Shimla Police filed an FIR against Delhi Police personnel for allegedly abducting three Youth Congress members. The Delhi team was detained, released by a court, and then detained again, escalating tensions between the two state police forces.

title: 'Hum sath aage badh rahe hain': Netanyahu shares car ride with PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a car ride to a technology exhibition after Modi addressed the Knesset. Modi was honored with the "Speaker of the Knesset Medal" for strengthening bilateral ties. Netanyahu praised Modi's strong moral support following the October 7th Hamas attack.

title: Pakistan semi-final scenario: What Sri Lanka exit means for their chances
content: New Zealand's decisive win over Sri Lanka has eliminated the co-hosts from the T20 World Cup. This result, however, keeps Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive. The final qualification spot from Group 2 now hinges on the England versus New Zealand match, with Pakistan needing a significant victory in their final game to potentially advance.

title: Sai Pallavi's home & project: Actor prefers simple family spaces over luxury
content: Sai Pallavi, a humble actress with an estimated net worth of Rs 45-50 crore, prefers serene, family-oriented homes over lavish properties. Her main residence in Coimbatore reflects a traditional South Indian style, emphasizing comfort and nature. She also owns a peaceful retreat in Kotagiri, showcasing her connection to the environment and simple living.

title: Told to pay, BJP MLA Chaudhary Babulal’s son slaps Agra toll plaza employee
content: Son of Fatehpur Sikri MLA Chaudhary Babulal allegedly slapped a toll employee at Raybha toll plaza after being asked to pay the toll fee due to a missing FASTag. The incident, captured on CCTV, was reportedly resolved amicably with the toll worker declining to file a complaint. The MLA, however, alleged abusive behavior from the toll staff.

title: Toxic trade in Mumbai: Vendors caught applying rat poison to fruits in Malad
content: Two fruit vendors in Malad were arrested for applying rat poison to fruits, claiming it was to deter rodents. Citizens caught them in the act and alerted the police, leading to their apprehension and an FIR under the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Spurs vs Raptors Injury Report: Who’s In, Out and Key Stats
content: San Antonio, riding a nine-game win streak, faces Toronto on February 25, 2026, as 7.5-point favorites.  The Spurs boast a strong record and historical dominance over the Raptors.  Toronto's chances hinge on Scottie Barnes' availability, with key players out for both sides due to G League assignments.  Wembanyama's presence looms large.

title: Los Angeles Lakers eye $131M Cavaliers star; Austin Reaves trade key?
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Oilers stuck with $7.2 million player after trade talks suddenly fall apart
content: The Edmonton Oilers explored trading Andrew Mangiapane to the Toronto Maple Leafs in a cap motivated move, but talks stalled due to lack of interest. Mangiapane’s reduced role and modest production have made him a likely trade candidate. With the NHL deadline approaching, Edmonton remains active in reshaping its roster for a stronger playoff push.

title: Patrick, Brittany Mahomes’ $275M KC Current gain national spotlight after ESPN move
content: ESPN’s new programming shift and upcoming docuseries are set to boost visibility for the Kansas City Current, the NWSL club co-owned by Patrick and Brittany Mahomes. With Women’s Sports Sundays replacing a long-running broadcast slot and NWSL: The Final Third premiering soon, the move reflects growing demand for women’s sports and positions the Current for unprecedented national exposure.

title: Cigarettes after tax: The post-February crisis, & how smokers are reacting
content: India's recent steep cigarette tax hike has triggered immediate chaos, with prices soaring and supplies dwindling. Retailers are struggling, and consumers face inflated costs. This mirrors global trends where high taxes, without robust enforcement, fuel illicit trade and organized crime, potentially undermining public health goals and government revenue.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for Feb 26 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, Colgate-Palmolive (India), and JSW Steel are the top stock picks that Aakash K Hindocha, Deputy Vice President - WM Research of Nuvama Professional Clients Group has listed. He also shares his outlook for Nifty, and Bank Nifty for February 26, 2026:

title: 4 passengers of US speedboat shot dead by Cuban coast guard
content: Cuba's coastguard shot dead four people and injured six others travelling in a US-registered speedboat in an exchange of fire off the Cuban coast on Wednesday, the interior ministry in Havana said. As a coastguard vessel approached to identify the boat "shots were fired from the boat," injuring the commander of the Cuban vessel, the ministry added.

title: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza 15 runs away from making T20I history vs India
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza is on the verge of a historic T20I milestone, needing just 15 runs to become the first Zimbabwean to reach 3000 international runs. He aims to achieve this in their crucial Super Eight match against defending champions India.  This encounter is vital for both teams' semi-final aspirations in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

title: His grandfather gave British Rs 35k loan in 1917, now, MP man wants payback
content: A Sehore family is seeking to recover Rs 35,000 advanced by their grandfather to the British government in 1917. The prominent businessman's family claims the loan, made to the political agent in Bhopal, was never repaid. They are now exploring legal avenues to pursue this colonial-era financial claim against the United Kingdom.

title: PM Modi becomes first world leader to cross 100 million Instagram followers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has achieved a historic milestone. He is now the first world leader to surpass 100 million followers on Instagram. This achievement highlights his significant global digital reach. Modi's follower count far exceeds other prominent world leaders. His popularity continues to grow worldwide.

title: Taylor Swift’s $12K Louis Vuitton look stuns on date with Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's stunning Louis Vuitton look turned heads during a Los Angeles date night with Travis Kelce. While her fashion statement captivated fans, the appearance coincided with growing speculation about Kelce's NFL future. Chiefs management confirmed they are preparing for both his return and potential retirement after a challenging season.

title: India, Israel likely to ink MoU on tech transfer for Iron Dome, Iron Beam, advanced missiles
content: India and Israel are poised to sign a landmark defense agreement, focusing on technology transfer for advanced weapons systems. The deal aims to bolster India's missile defense capabilities with Israeli systems like Iron Dome and Iron Beam, enhancing its security against aerial threats and fortifying its borders.

title: 'Can’t let craziest regime to have nuclear weapons': JD Vance ahead of US-Iran talks in Geneva
content: US Vice President JD Vance stated that the Trump administration is committed to preventing Iran, described as the world's "craziest and worst regime," from obtaining nuclear weapons. While prioritizing diplomacy, Vance emphasized that President Trump possesses other tools to achieve this goal, urging Iran to take negotiations seriously.

title: 'Does not make sense': India coach drops verdict on Abhishek Sharma's poor form
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak backs under-pressure openers Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma ahead of their must-win T20 World Cup match against Zimbabwe. Kotak believes both players are close to finding form, emphasizing that focusing too much on individual struggles can be detrimental. He defended Varma's strike rate, citing specific match situations and team strategy.

title: Sanju Samson all set to feature in India’s must-win clash vs Zimbabwe
content: Defending champions India are considering changes to their opening partnership for a crucial Super Eights match against Zimbabwe. With qualification on the line after a loss to South Africa, wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson is a potential option to address struggles at the top of the order, particularly Abhishek Sharma's lean run.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' inside report: Vijay's film is politically charged
content: Vijay's highly anticipated film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces censor board hurdles due to its strong political messaging.  The Revising Committee flagged its intense political flavor, aligning with Vijay's political aspirations.  Producers are now considering a June 18 release, strategically timed near his birthday, after initial delays.

title: 4 Indian American scientists win $75K at one of America’s most elite research honours
content: Four Indian American researchers have been honoured as 2026 Sloan Research Fellows, a prestigious early-career recognition. Their groundbreaking work in cryptography, statistics, AI reliability and quantum computing from Carnegie Mellon University and MIT highlights the significant contributions of diaspora scientists. This award provides crucial support for their transformative research endeavours.

title: Mallikarjun Mutya of Mahal Roja Mutt in Yadgir district of Karnataka booked under POCSO Act after viral video for allegedly misbehaving with minor girl
content: The police action came after Child Development Project Officer, Shahapur, lodged a complaint as per instructions issued by the District Child Welfare Committee, which conducted an enquiry with the girl and her parents as well

title: Tamil Nadu: a trendsetter for all-round development
content: Unlike in other States such as Maharashtra and Karnataka, where economic activity is concentrated in a couple of cities, Tamil Nadu has been witnessing dispersed development.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Rohit Pawar accuses Mumbai police of not registering FIR, his complaint sent to State CID
content: Marine Drive Police station issued a statement saying that as per an already existent FIR, the case was being probed by the Maharashtra Crime Investigation Department

title: SC hearing on NCERT Class 8 textbook LIVE updates: 'Deep-rooted conspiracy,' says CJI on inclusion of chapter on 'corruption' in judiciary
content: NCERT has issued a statement apologising for the “inappropriate textual material” and said the distribution of the book has been stopped

title: Book on life, journey of journalist late N. R. Swami released in Odisha
content: The book titled ‘The Doyen of Odisha Journalism’ highlights Swami’s protracted court battle against Odisha government accused him of being on the payroll of a foreign agency

title: YSRCP chief Jagan visits temple in Pulivendula constituency
content: He also conducted a ‘Praja Darbar’ at his camp office and received grievances from people from his constituency

title: Kerala veers from impressive social gains to mounting fiscal strain
content: The biggest challenge faced by successive State governments in Kerala has been keeping expenditure down without undermining its pro-social sector fiscal policies.

title: PM Modi to visit Holocaust memorial in Israel; hold meetings with President Herzog, Netanyahu | LIVE
content: On the second day of his visit to Israel, he will be engaging with prominent members of the Indian-Jewish Community

title: Dream of Karnataka govt. jobs brings youth in droves to Dharwad’s coaching centres and study halls
content: For long Dharwad has been the education hub of north Karnataka. Cashing on the brand name of Dharwad, over 30 coaching centres have come up here over the last few years

title: Govt. mandates sale of 20% ethanol-blended petrol with minimum RON 95 nationwide from April 1
content: The central government can allow exceptions in special situations, for specific regions and for a limited time

title: AI Summit protest: Dramatic standoff between Delhi and Shimla police ends after 24 hours
content: The Himachal Pradesh Police registered a kidnapping case against the Delhi Police personnel and "detained" their vehicles at the Shogi border near Shimla on February 25, 2026

title: CM Adityanath invited Japanese entrepreneurs to invest in Uttar Pradesh
content: Mr. Adityanath also informed the Japanese that a State (U.P.) once referred to as BIMARU has today become the growth engine of India’s economy

title: Income Tax department conducts searches at lone BSP MLA house, U.P. Minister questions move
content: Dinesh Pratap Singh, a U.P. Government Minister who is related to the BSP MLA, objected to the action through posts on social media.

title: Motorists complain of bumpy ride on newly built flyover
content: They say Madhya Kailash flyover does not offer a smooth ride; highway officials point out that the surface was kept rough to prevent speeding

title: Two-child norm for panchayat, local body elections scrapped in Rajasthan after three decades
content: Congress strongly criticises the State Cabinet’s decision; the BJP on the one hand advises a particular community to control population growth, and was repealing the two-child norm on the other, Govind Singh Dotasra says

title: NCERT apologises, says distribution of book with section on ‘corruption’ in judiciary stopped
content: After the Supreme court registers suo motu case over the matter, the NCERT apologises for the ‘inappropriate textual material’ and ‘error in judgement’ that had ‘inadvertently crept’ into the chapter.

title: Political criticism that ruling party may even ‘give a wife to everyone’ is not misogynistic: Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira quashes proceedings initiated by Tamil Nadu Commission for Women against AIADMK MP C.Ve. Shanmugam for making such a statement

title: CBI arrests three in ‘digital arrest’ fraud case after searches in six States
content: ‘Through meticulous digital forensics and financial trail analysis, investigators uncovered a complex network spanning multiple States, with indications of international linkages,’ the CBI says

title: Cash row: Lok Sabha Speaker reconstitutes panel probing charges against Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The Speaker had constituted the committee on August 12 last year after admitting a multi-party notice for the removal of the Allahabad High Court judge, setting in motion the process of his impeachment.

title: Karnataka High Court lays down procedure to access spouse’s income-tax returns in matrimonial disputes
content: The Karnataka High Court has issued comprehensive guidelines for spouses to obtain income tax returns and financial records of their partners in maintenance proceedings, as the law does not permit couples in matrimonial disputes to access each other’s financial data under the Right to Information Act

title: Govt. IVF services changing fertility landscape in Telangana; State-run hospitals log 190 infertility cases
content: This case comes amid a steady expansion of infertility services at government healthcare institutions in Telangana over the past year.

title: Rahul targets Modi over trip to Israel and trade deal with U.S., brings up ‘Epstein Files’
content: Mr. Gandhi questions PM’s trip amid Indo-U.S. trade deal row while Congress leader Pawan Khera cites ‘Epstein Files’ emails, alleging foundation of India-Israel ties was laid by late American financier and child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Food Safety officers launch State-wide milk safety inspections after deaths
content: Samples of milk and other dairy products are being collected from vendors to check if there is any urea or starch adulteration, says State IPM Director

title: Real-estate promoter shot dead in Howrah, journalist assaulted after questioning Trinamool MLA over links to the crime
content: Videos of the accused in the murder riding pillion on local Trinamool Congress MLA Gautam Chowdhury’s motorbike surfaced on social media

title: ‘Sorry Papa, galti se ho gaya’: Lucknow teen’s apology after shooting, dismembering father
content: A 19-year-old son allegedly shot his pathologist father with a licensed rifle following an argument over NEET preparation. He then dismembered the body, concealed parts in a drum and plastic, and dumped them. The accused confessed after police grew suspicious of his behavior.

title: Officials to keep track of census data collection real time
content: Around 32 lakh field functionaries will be deployed for census operations; satellite imagery will be used for clear identification of habitations and settlements

title: NIA arrests two more accused in Delhi car bomb blast case
content: The federal agency says the two are over ground workers of the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGH) terror outfit and allegedly supplied weapons to the prime accused in the case, Umar Un Nabi, who was also killed in the explosion

title: Amit Shah on three-day visit to Bihar’s Seemanchal
content: In three-day visit, the Home Minister will participate in various initiatives, including the inauguration of border outposts, and the e-inauguration and foundation laying of several works of the Sashastra Seema Bal

title: SRMIST, The Hindu to organise panel discussion series on future careers
content: The series is aimed at benefiting undergraduate aspirants, postgraduate candidates, and working professionals in various fields such as humanities and sciences, entrepreneurship, law, public health, pharmacology, allied health sciences and nursing, medical and dental sciences, occupational therapy and physiotherapy, engineering, and agriculture.

title: 629 cow smuggling cases registered in Gujarat in two years
content: Minister of State for Law and Justice Kaushik Vekariya said 50 people were externed and 39 properties linked to the accused, collectively valued at around ₹6 crore, were demolished

title: Cases stall as judicial officers busy with SIR in West Bengal
content: Former Rajya Sabha MP Jawhar Sircar, who had served as Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal, said that involving judicial officers in SIR appeared to be a ‘knee-jerk reaction’

title: SIM-binding directions for platforms to stay: Minister
content: The November 2025 order, due for compliance this month, will not be extended, says Communications Minister. He says ‘national security’ and ‘fraud’ were considered in issuing this order, which WhatsApp parent Meta has pushed back on through industry associations.

title: ‘Shirtless’ protest: Three more Congress workers held in Shimla
content: Saurabh, Siddharth and Arbaz apprehended by Special Cell of Delhi Police from a hotel in Shimla district; arrests led to a dramatic turn of events after Himachal Police intercepted the Delhi Police team while they were transporting the accused to Delhi

title: Bill meant to replace UGC, AICTE circulated among 39 Ministries, departments for discussions, says government
content: 31-member JPC, which was set up to examine Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, will hold its first meeting today Bill

title: Centre rejects RTI seeking details of pre-legislative consultations on VB-G RAM G Act
content: In its response, the Rural Development Ministry said the information could not be shared because the scheme ‘has not yet been formally notified by the States/UTs and has not become operational in any State/U.T.’

title: ‘Loose connection’ prevented NVS-02 satellite from landing in intended orbit, says panel
content: The committee, which probed the failure, says the signal meant to activate a key valve in the engine’s oxidiser line never reached it; this valve is crucial for firing the engine to raise the spacecraft’s orbit

title: PM Modi conferred with Israel’s ‘Speaker of the Knesset Medal’
content: The medal was conferred in recognition of the Prime Minister’s exceptional contribution — through his personal leadership — to strengthen strategic relations between India and Israel

title: Palaniswami hits back at Stalin, calls the DMK a ‘slave’ of the Congress
content: ‘We have never been slaves of anyone. We believe in our constructive work. By implementing [welfare] projects, we had secured the support [of the Centre]. But your party is not like us. The Congress had secured seats by intimidating the DMK,’ the AIADMK leader says at a meeting at Vanagaram near Chennai

title: Ahead of Assembly election, DMK women’s  grassroots push blends politics with AR outreach
content: ‘Vellum Tamil Pengal’ campaign deploys booth-level women cadres armed with booklets, QR codes and augmented reality to deepen voter connect — while opening new space for women in party politics.

title: ECI proposes synergy with SECs to align electoral processes nationwide
content: Commission moots sharing of Electronic Voting Machines (EVM), electoral rolls and the ECINET digital platform.

title: Kochi City police screen footage of accidents to sensitise bus drivers
content: Videos of around 25 recent accidents, captured by CCTVs on the accident spots and those installed inside buses, from different parts of the State were screened

title: India ‘stands firmly’ with Israel, Modi tells Knesset
content: Prime Minister addresses the Israeli parliament as he begins visit to the West Asian country; India has an uncompromising policy of zero tolerance for terrorism with no double standard, he adds

title: 1.2 crore names may be deleted after SIR in Bengal, says Mamata
content: Will pray for the people who will find their names deleted from the final electoral rolls on February 28, says Trinamool Congress chairperson

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Ranya, others in gold smuggling and money laundering case
content: According to the ED, its investigation revealed that a total of 127.287 kg of gold valued at approximately ₹102.55 crore was smuggled into India between March 2024 and March 2025

title: Government to procure business jets for defence dignitaries and chiefs of armed forces
content: The decision to get a new fleet comes in the backdrop of the crash of a VSR Ventures-owned aircraft on January 28 that claimed the lives of Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, and four others

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu discuss wide range of issues aimed at boosting bilateral ties
content: Narendra Modi, who is visiting Israel for the second time in nine years, was received by Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara, at the airport.

title: Police intensify probe into IIT Palakkad attack
content: Police suspect the assault was premeditated, noting that it took place in a poorly lit area of the campus that lacked surveillance camera coverage

title: ‘Karaparamba fish market, Puthiyangadi market buildings in need of urgent action’
content: An inspection by a team of engineers under the Kozhikode Corporation have so far completed the inspection of 12 age-old buildings within the city to check their fitness

title: U.S. slaps 126% duty on Indian solar imports
content: Tariffs were collectively imposed on India, Indonesia and Laos following  investigation that is ongoing

title: BJP warns of protest if recruitment process is not initiated in Karnataka
content: Taking exception to the State government not going ahead with recruitments to government posts as promised by the Congress before the Assembly elections, BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra warned of a protest if the recruitment process was not initiated

title: Protest by farmers against safari and illegal resorts in Karnataka’s forests to continue indefinitely
content: The farmers had arrived at the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Mysuru in a motorcycle rally from Gun House circle on Wednesday, and staged a protest

title: PM Modi condoles death of veteran CPI leader Nallakannu
content: R. Nallakannu died at a government hospital in Chennai due to age-related ailments; he was about 101 years old.

title: Kerala’s Puthur Zoological Park to open for public on February 28
content: To help visitors explore the park, two non-AC electric buses of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation have been readied. 330 animals have been shifted to 14 habitats

title: YSRCP regime destroyed State, says Naidu
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy played a false drama that Veligonda works were finished and dedicated the project to the nation without completing them, claims Chief Minister

title: YC urges Kerala Governor not to approve State govt. nominee as PSC member
content: Youth Congress State president criticises government’s decision to raise upper age limit for PSC examinations to 40, calling it misleading and unfair to existing job aspirants

title: Hilary Knight: Women's team joke 'distasteful'
content: American gold medalist Hilary Knight called President Trump's comment about the women's team "distasteful" but said she chooses to celebrate the women's accomplishments.

title: Cincy sues transfer QB Sorsby over $1M exit fee
content: Cincinnati is suing former quarterback Brendan Sorsby, alleging he breached his NIL contract with the Bearcats by refusing to pay a $1 million exit fee following his transfer to Texas Tech.

title: UConn by 32 in Pitino's biggest loss at St. John's
content: UConn avenged a Feb. 6 loss by handing St. John's its largest defeat under Rick Pitino, a 72-40 blowout Wednesday night in which the Red Storm missed their final 24 field goal attempts.

title: Suns' Ishbia offers $1M to All-Star contest winners
content: Suns owner Mat Ishbia wants more star players participating in All-Star Weekend events when Phoenix hosts next year -- and is hoping to entice them by offering a $1 million prize to the winners of the slam dunk and 3-point contests.

title: Banned by NBA, Porter joins USBL's SuperHawks
content: Jontay Porter, banned for life by the NBA for gambling in 2024 and currently awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty to a related federal charge, is planning to play for an upstart pro basketball league.

title: Sabathia to be 24th Yankee with retired number
content: CC Sabathia's No. 52 will be retired on Sept. 26 by the Yankees, who will dedicate a plaque in the Hall of Famer's honor at Monument Park before that day's game.

title: Devils honor Jack Hughes as NHL play resumes
content: U.S. Olympic hero Jack Hughes was honored by the Devils before their game Wednesday night against the Sabres.

title: Galloway, '72 Olympian and walk-run pioneer, dies
content: Jeff Galloway, a member of the 1972 U.S. Olympic team who for decades inspired elite athletes and countless everyday runners by promoting a run-walk-run strategy, whether in a marathon or just a neighborhood jog, died Wednesday at age 80.

title: 🏈 Kiper's NFL mock draft: Projecting Round 1
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class will get picked in April.

title: Bubble Watch: Missouri gets promoted up the SEC pecking order
content: The Tigers have a much easier case for one of the SEC's 10 or 11 bids after defeating Tennessee on Tuesday.

title: Coaching carousel: Who's on the hot seat? Which are the names to watch?
content: The schools (Oklahoma? Syracuse?), names (Will Wade? Porter Moser? Josh Schertz?) and buzz we're tracking.

title: Who will start at quarterback for the Vikings, Browns and Jets? We made QB1 predictions for all 32 teams
content: Will Kirk Cousins go back to Minnesota? Could Kyler Murray join the AFC? Let's predict who will start for every team in the 2026 season.

title: Ranking the top offseason trade candidates: Who are the best players potentially available?
content: How do Brian Thomas Jr. and Maxx Crosby stack up on the trade market? We break down the latest intel.

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.
